The "Jump Start America Act of 2017" includes provisions for simplified individual income tax rates, a 20-percent corporate tax rate, a 15-percent maximum capital gains rate, modification and permanent extension of incentives to reinvest foreign earnings in the United States, and an increase of bonus depreciation to 100 percent made permanent. The "Jump Start America Act of 2017" includes provisions for simplified individual income tax rates, a 20-percent corporate tax rate, a 15-percent maximum capital gains rate, and the repeal of estate and gift taxes. Additionally, bonus depreciation is increased to 100 percent and made permanent. The "Jump Start America Act of 2017" includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, introducing 20 and 30 percent rate brackets for taxable income exceeding $1,000,000 starting after December 31, 2015. The "Jump Start America Act of 2017" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to increase the $1,000,000 amount for taxable years after 2016 by a cost-of-living adjustment determined for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. Adjustments not multiples of $100 are rounded down. The amendments made by the "Jump Start America Act of 2017" apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2017. TITLE II--20-PERCENT CORPORATE TAX RATE - SEC. 201. 20-PERCENT CORPORATE TAX RATE. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to impose a 20 percent tax on taxable income. Conforming amendments are made to adjust tax rates and calculations in various sections of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to adjust tax rates and calculations in various sections. Section 1445(e)(6) is amended to replace "35 percent" with the rate of tax under section 11(b). Section 1446(b)(2)(B) is amended to replace "section 11(b)(1)" with "section 11(b)". Section 852(b)(1) is amended by removing the last sentence. Section 7874(e)(1)(B) is amended to replace "section 11(b)(1)" with "section 11(b)". The amendments made by this section will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2017, and withholding changes will apply to distributions made after the same date. TITLE III--15-PERCENT MAXIMUM CAPITAL GAINS RATE

Section 1(h)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to establish a 15 percent maximum capital gains rate for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017. SEC. 401. This deduction affects the computation of any recapture amount under section 280F(b)(2). Starting from 2019, the $8,000 amount will be adjusted for inflation annually. TITLE VI--FICA AND SECA TAX RATE REDUCTIONS

SEC. 601. FICA TAX RATE REDUCTIONS.

(a) Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance.--Sections 3101(a) and 3111(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are each amended by reducing the tax rates from 6.2 percent to 3.1 percent.

(b) Hospital Insurance.--Employee and employer tax rates for Hospital Insurance are also reduced from 1.45 percent to 0.725 percent and from 0.9 percent to 0.45 percent, respectively.

(c) Effective Date.--These changes apply to remuneration paid after December 31, 2017.

SEC. 602. SECA TAX RATE REDUCTIONS. SEC. 602. SECA TAX RATE REDUCTIONS. Amends the tax rates for Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance and Hospital Insurance to 6.2 percent and 1.45 percent respectively. Effective date is after December 31, 2017. REPEAL OF ESTATE AND GIFT TAXES: Subtitle B of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, which includes estate, gift, and generation-skipping taxes, is repealed. This repeal applies to estates of decedents dying, gifts made, and generation-skipping transfers made after the enactment of this Act.
